channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overflowing rubbish, 24th August
item.description:
There is a mix of commercial and household waste that is overflying , smells and is attracting vermin It’s been several weeks since last collected.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lane, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress dumped on pavement, 24th August
item.description:
Mattress dumped on pavement by van with license plate DL21 NTM at around 11pm on 25/08.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Tuskar Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole & Subsidence Alert – Urgent Repair Required, 24th August
item.description:
There are multiple large potholes and clear signs of subsidence along this stretch of road, creating a serious hazard for drivers, cyclists, and pedestrians. Other roads of better condition have been repaired in area. Why hasn’t this stretch been treated? The surface is breaking up and worsening quickly. Immediate inspection and repair are required to prevent accidents, damage to vehicles, and further deterioration of the road surface. Please prioritise this as an urgent safety issue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rochester Drive, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead cat outside 133 bedonwell road, 24th August
item.description:

item.title: Hedge blocking path, 24th August
item.description:
On busy school route - must be cut right back to wall, not allowed to overhang at all. Please take action to prevent accidents now. Just come and cut it back to the border of the property and stop accepting this shoddy and dangerous behaviour. MP alerted. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 274, Barry Road, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Household rubbish, 24th August
item.description:
I am reporting this problem because I am fed up cleaning it up. Someone continues to use the on street rubbish bin to get rid of their food scraps and the foxes are pulling it out of the bin and it’s now strewn across the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grosvenor Park, Camberwell, London

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Flytipped cot, 24th August
item.description:
This cot has been left on pavement outside this property for a week now. I guess they thought someone might want it but clearly noone does as it would have gone by now. No sign of the owner taking responsibility for it so please clear the obstruction from the footpath..Thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palace Grove, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped rubbish, 24th August

item.title: Huge rubbish dump next to screwfix, 24th August
item.description:
Rubbish has been getting dumped in this small alcove next to Screwfix & entrance 2 of milestone house. Its piling up every single day (been there for over 2 weeks already) and its just vile. Please collect and keep our streets clean!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 434, Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins and rubbish blocking pavement, 24th August
item.description:
No. 55 keep all their household waste bins on the public footpath. They have plenty of space in their front garden. This means rubbish is strewn out all over the pavement and prams and wheelchairs can't get past. This has been a problem for many years.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queens Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
